name: arrayFilter
syntax: arrayFilter(array array, function(item, [index, [array]]) closure, [boolean parallel], [number maxThreads])
description: Used to filter an array to items for which the closure function returns true.

params.name: function
params.description: Inline closure function executed for each element in the array. Returns true if the array element should be included in the filtered array. Support for passing the original array to the closure function added in CF11 Update 5.

params.name: parallel
params.description: Lucee only option, true or false if the items can be executed in parallel

params.name: maxThreads
params.description: Lucee only option, the number of threads to use when parallel = true

examples.title: Example using a simple numeric comparison
examples.description: Take an array of struct items and use arrayFilter to return ones of a rating 3 and higher.
examples.result: Array with the structs for apple, orange and kiwi.

examples.title: Example using a member function
examples.description: This is the same example as above, but using a member function on the array instead of a standalone function.
examples.result: Array with the structs for apple, orange and kiwi.
